00001 /* The following code example is taken from the book
00002  * "C++ Templates - The Complete Guide"
00003  * by David Vandevoorde and Nicolai M. Josuttis, Addison-Wesley, 2002
00004  *
00005  * (C) Copyright David Vandevoorde and Nicolai M. Josuttis 2002.
00006  * Permission to copy, use, modify, sell and distribute this software

00008  * This software is provided "as is" without express or implied
00009  * warranty, and with no claim as to its suitability for any purpose.
00010  */
00011 
00012 namespace cupp {
00013 namespace kernel_magic {
00014 
00015 // primary template handles maximum number of parameters:
00016 template<typename RT, typename P1 = void, 
00017                       typename P2 = void,
00018                       typename P3 = void>
00019 class FunctionPtrT {
00020   public:
00021     enum { NumParams = 3 };
00022     typedef RT (*Type)(P1,P2,P3);
00023 };
00024 
00025 // partial specialization for two parameters:
00026 template<typename RT, typename P1,
00027                       typename P2>
00028 class FunctionPtrT<RT, P1, P2, void> {
00029   public:
00030     enum { NumParams = 2 };
00031     typedef RT (*Type)(P1,P2);
00032 };
00033 
00034 // partial specialization for one parameter:
00035 template<typename RT, typename P1>
00036 class FunctionPtrT<RT, P1, void, void> {
00037   public:
00038     enum { NumParams = 1 };
00039     typedef RT (*Type)(P1);
00040 };
00041 
00042 // partial specialization for no parameters:
00043 template<typename RT>
00044 class FunctionPtrT<RT, void, void, void> {
00045   public:
00046     enum { NumParams = 0 };
00047     typedef RT (*Type)();
00048 };
00049 
00050 }
00051 }
